DataElement.preferredName: Current Medication Vitamin Dietary Supplement Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A textual description of the current medication(s) an individual is taking.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The current medications an individual is taking._A group of organic food substances found in animals and plants in small quantities. They must be supplied in diet or dietary supplement and are essential for normal metabolism._Oral preparations containing dietary ingredient(s) intended to supplement the diet.  Dietary ingredients include vitamins, minerals, herbs, amino acids, extracts and metabolites.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The current medications an individual is taking.

Concepts.definition: The current medications an individual is taking.

Property.preferredDefinition: A nutrient that the body needs in small amounts to function and stay healthy. Sources of vitamins are plant and animal food products and dietary supplements. Some vitamins are made in the human body from food products. Vitamins are either fat-soluble (can dissolve in fats and oils) or water-soluble (can dissolve in water). Excess fat-soluble vitamins are stored in the body's fatty tissue, but excess water-soluble vitamins are removed in the urine. Examples are vitamin A, vitamin C, and vitamin E.:Oral preparations containing dietary ingredient(s) intended to supplement the diet.  Dietary ingredients include vitamins, minerals, herbs, amino acids, extracts and metabolites.

Concepts.definition: A group of organic food substances found in animals and plants in small quantities. They must be supplied in diet or dietary supplement and are essential for normal metabolism.
Oral preparations containing dietary ingredient(s) intended to supplement the diet.  Dietary ingredients include vitamins, minerals, herbs, amino acids, extracts and metabolites.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).
